> i am having some private methods in a class. how to test
> them. can any body send a sample code how to test private
> method.... or can any body send the url
>


This doesn't really answer your question, but when I find I have a class
with a bunch of private methods I want to test then I usually extract
those methods out into another class and make them public.

A contrived example, the before picture looks kind of like this:
public class SomeClass
{
public boolean method1()
{
if (method3())
return method4();
return true;
}
public boolean method2()
{
return method5();
}
private boolean method3()
{
return true;
}
private boolean method4()
{
return false;
}
private boolean method5()
{
return true;
}
}


The after picture looks something like this:
public class SomeClass
{
private final OtherClass m_otherClass;

public SomeClass()
{
m_otherClass = new SomeOtherClass();
}

public boolean method1()
{
if (m_otherClass.method3())
return m_otherClass.method4();
return true;
}
public boolean method2()
{
return m_otherClass.method5();
}
}

public class OtherClass()
{
public boolean method3()
{
return true;
}
public boolean method4()
{
return false;
}
public boolean method5()
{
return true;
}
}

The private methods are now public in their own class and easy to test.
I don't do this all the time, but if the private methods can be
logically grouped together and can provide functionality outside of the
class they were originally defined in then I think it makes sense to do
this.

Hope this helps,

Kris
